Attention Class of 2020: You still have time to be eligible for Bright Future scholarships! The Florida Department of Education has extended the required testing deadlines until December 1, 2020, per Executive Order 20-212.

✔️ Sign up for the SAT at https://collegereadiness.collegeboard.org/sat or the ACT at http://www.act.org
✔️ Make sure you sign up with the exact name on your high school transcript or report card
✔️ Be prepared to have a credit card payment or fee waiver ready
✔️ There are a limited number of seats due to safety guidelines
✔️ When you sign up, know what school(s) you want your scores sent to (you have to choose at least one in Florida)
Bright Futures obtains your scores when you send them to a high school, college or tech school in Florida

PS, All eligible students from the 2020 graduating class were given 100 hours of community service per the DOE due to COVID.

MENTAL HEALTH MONTH: While 1 in 5 people will experience a mental illness during their lifetime, and everyone faces challenges in life that can impact their mental health. Mental health is essential to everyone's overall health and wellbeing, and mental illnesses are common and treatable. - Mental Health America

COLLARS & SCHOLARS: The Humane Society of Sarasota County shared several take-home worksheets from their Collars and Scholars program for your family to enjoy at home.

Collars & Scholars, HSSC’s newest humane education program, is a nine-week course that emphasizes the concepts of self-awareness, empathy, and compassion—for other people and for animals. This program is a joint venture of HSSC and The Florida Center for Early Childhood, brought together by the Community Foundation of Sarasota County.

The pilot program, which ran February–May 2019, took place at Gocio Elementary School and consisted of a small group of fourth and fifth graders. All the participants were selected by the school-based mental health therapist. The program uses the principles of the human-animal bond to boost students’ social and emotional health.

Learn more https://hssc.org/get-involved/humane-education/collars-and-scholars

Nadia Meyer, Booker Middle School VPA Digital Design student, created this moving Google Doodle titled "Kindness is a Cure."

When asked what her inspiration was, Nadia said, "The inspiration were the many visits I gave my grandfather when he was in the hospital. During his time in the hospital, he was very lonely. Every time we visited him, his face would light up. He never stopped telling us how much he appreciated our company. I want others to know that just stopping by to see how a sick friend or family member is doing can make their day. I feel that people often forget such an important yet small act of kindness."

PINE VIEW: The Pine View School for the Gifted Speech and Debate team takes a road trip up to Emory University every year for the prestigious Barkley Forum for High Schools (BFHS) event. After performing phenomenally over the past few years, PVS has officially been selected as a Member School!

In a letter from the Director of the Barkley Forum, Mr. Ed Lee says, "Only the finest speech and debate programs in the country are selected for this honor. For 65 years, this group of schools has represented the very best in schools committed to teaching critical thinking, public presentation skills, and top-level research. More than 200 high schools attend the BFHS every year from 35 states. Your school has demonstrated academic and competitive excellence worthy of substantial notice."

Congrats, Pine View! And a special shout out to Speech and Debate Coach, Mr. Jym Froelich!

ESE SURVEY: The ESE Parent Survey window is open until May 31, 2020. Your feedback is important in helping the state and local school systems continue improving educational programs for children with special needs, so please participate!

Each year, the Florida Department of Education surveys parents of children with Individual Educational Plans (IEPs) to determine how well a child’s school is partnering with the family, including promoting family involvement in a child’s education. All states must collect this data as part of their State Performance Plan, as required under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).

How do I take the survey?
- Request a paper copy from your child’s school
- Complete the survey online here: http://www.esesurvey.com
